summary: This is an email chain from May 28, 2021, where a journalist from the NY Daily News, Stephen Brown, queries a government official (likely a DOJ/SDNY spokesperson) about the deferred prosecution agreement for Epstein's correctional officers. The journalist seeks background on the decision and asks about rumors of the officers potentially meeting with AG Barr or Epstein's family as part of the deal.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry on Epstein Guards DPA
events.description: NY Daily News journalist Stephen Brown emails a government contact with questions about the deferred prosecution agreement for Epstein's correctional officers, Michael and Tova, including rumors about potential meetings with AG Barr or Epstein's family.

keyFacts: A deferred prosecution agreement (DPA) was offered to Epstein's correctional officers, Michael and Tova, related to the investigation into Epstein's death.
Journalist sources claim falsely filling out paperwork is 'standard operating procedure' throughout the Bureau of Prisons (BOP).
Rumors suggested the DPA might have included the officers agreeing to meet with Attorney General Barr or Epstein's family, though the journalist expresses skepticism.
The dysfunction at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) is cited as strengthening the guards' 'scapegoat defense' since their arrest.
